          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, we both know that's a bit steep.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

1895-09-14 00:00:00 Scene 4 --- Participants: ['Lennon Figtree', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- premise: The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

1895-09-14 00:00:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, I can't let these beauties go for that price. How about we say...
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, I can't let these beauties go for that price. How about we say...
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Worth every copper.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, we both know that's a bit steep.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in Fruitville.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I've been comin' to your stall for years now. You know I always pay a fair price, but these apples are a bit steep for my budget.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, I can't let these beauties go for that price. How about we say...
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, I can't let these beauties go for that price. How about we say...
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to make a counteroffer.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1854 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was six years old, he watched a sparrow snatch a plump fig from his father's stall, its tiny beak stained purple. He felt a pang of sympathy for the bird, but also a thrill at the audacity of the theft. He wondered if he could be as bold, as quick, as free.
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was nine years old, he helped his father bargain with a surly farmer for a basket of bruised peaches. He saw how his father used charm and wit to lower the price, and Cedric realized that words could be weapons as sharp as any knife.
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was thirteen years old, he snuck away from the stall and wandered into the bustling marketplace, mesmerized by the exotic spices and vibrant fabrics. He longed to explore the world beyond his father's fruit stand, to taste the unknown and gather stories of his own.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was sixteen years old, he convinced a wealthy merchant to pay double the price for a crate of apples, claiming they were a rare and prized variety. The lie sat heavy on his conscience, but the thrill of the deception and the clink of coins in his pocket was intoxicating.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was nineteen years old, he left his father's stall with a knapsack full of dreams and a cart laden with fruit. He promised himself he would travel the world, taste its bounty, and make his own fortune.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was twenty-one years old, he found himself stranded in a remote village after a storm ruined his fruit. Desperate, he resorted to stealing food, justifying his actions as a necessary evil.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Worth every copper.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, we both know that's a bit steep.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in Fruitville.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I've been comin' to your stall for years now. You know I always pay a fair price, but these apples are a bit steep for my budget.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          Current time: 1895-09-14 00:00:00.


          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is a fruit seller in Fruitville who tries to negotiate prices with customers at the market. He recently failed to reach an agreement with Della Plumstone but is now negotiating with Lennon Figtree.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a fruit seller in Fruitville who tries to negotiate prices with customers at the market. He recently failed to reach an agreement with Della Plumstone but is now negotiating with Lennon Figtree.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to make a counteroffer.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Cedric Meadowbrook likely to say next? Respond in the format `Cedric Meadowbrook -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, I can't let these beauties go for that price. How about we say...

1895-09-14 00:00:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I always pay a fair price, but that's a bit steep for me. How about we say...
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I always pay a fair price, but that's a bit steep for me. How about we say...
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Worth every copper.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, we both know that's a bit steep.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in Fruitville.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I've been comin' to your stall for years now. You know I always pay a fair price, but these apples are a bit steep for my budget.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, I can't let these beauties go for that price. How about we say...


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I always pay a fair price, but that's a bit steep for me. How about we say...
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I always pay a fair price, but that's a bit steep for me. How about we say...
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to try and negotiate a lower price with Cedric Meadowbrook.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1880 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 9 years old, he won the village's annual pie-eating contest, devouring a blueberry creation in record time. As the crowd cheered and showered him with praise, Lennon basked in the adoration, feeling a surge of pride and a yearning for more. He craved the spotlight, the feeling of being the center of attention.
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, he overheard his parents discussing their financial struggles. He felt a pang of annoyance, not for their hardship, but for the threat it posed to his own ambitions. He vowed to escape the confines of their humble life and build a world where his brilliance would be recognized and rewarded.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, he convinced a neighboring farmer to sell him a crate of peaches at a bargain price, then resold them for double the profit at the local market. The ease with which he manipulated the situation, the thrill of turning a quick buck, ignited a passion for commerce within him.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, he set off on his first solo journey as a traveling merchant, his wagon laden with apples and pears. He charmed his way into deals, his silver tongue weaving tales of exotic origins and exceptional quality, convincing customers to pay a premium for his wares.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, he found himself stranded in a remote village after a storm destroyed his wagon. Forced to rely on the kindness of strangers, he felt a flicker of vulnerability, a rare crack in his carefully constructed facade of self-assurance. However, he quickly recovered, using his charm to win over the villagers and secure their assistance.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Worth every copper.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, we both know that's a bit steep.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in Fruitville.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I've been comin' to your stall for years now. You know I always pay a fair price, but these apples are a bit steep for my budget.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, I can't let these beauties go for that price. How about we say...
          Current time: 1895-09-14 00:00:00.


          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, I can't let these beauties go for that price. How about we say...

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept Cedric Meadowbrook's counteroffer or reject it.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept Cedric Meadowbrook's counteroffer or reject it.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to try and negotiate a lower price with Cedric Meadowbrook.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Lennon Figtree likely to say next? Respond in the format `Lennon Figtree -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I always pay a fair price, but that's a bit steep for me. How about we say...

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['Lennon Figtree', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- premise: Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed 3 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed 3 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: 3 coins

      Name

      Action attempt
    • 3 coins

        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook that is low enough to be accepted, but high enough to allow for a profit when she resells the fruit in her hometown.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, he convinced a neighboring farmer to sell him a crate of peaches at a bargain price, then resold them for double the profit at the local market. The ease with which he manipulated the situation, the thrill of turning a quick buck, ignited a passion for commerce within him.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, he set off on his first solo journey as a traveling merchant, his wagon laden with apples and pears. He charmed his way into deals, his silver tongue weaving tales of exotic origins and exceptional quality, convincing customers to pay a premium for his wares.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, he found himself stranded in a remote village after a storm destroyed his wagon. Forced to rely on the kindness of strangers, he felt a flicker of vulnerability, a rare crack in his carefully constructed facade of self-assurance. However, he quickly recovered, using his charm to win over the villagers and secure their assistance.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Worth every copper.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, we both know that's a bit steep.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in Fruitville.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I've been comin' to your stall for years now. You know I always pay a fair price, but these apples are a bit steep for my budget.

Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I always pay a fair price, but that's a bit steep for me. How about we say...
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the fruit.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook that is low enough to be accepted, but high enough to allow for a profit when she resells the fruit in her hometown.

          Question: What price would Lennon Figtree propose?:
          (a) 4 coins
          (b) 2 coins
          (c) 5 coins
          (d) 1 coin
          (e) 3 coins
          Answer: (e)
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • reject

        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Lennon Figtree's offer of 3 coins.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was nineteen years old, he left his father's stall with a knapsack full of dreams and a cart laden with fruit. He promised himself he would travel the world, taste its bounty, and make his own fortune.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was twenty-one years old, he found himself stranded in a remote village after a storm ruined his fruit. Desperate, he resorted to stealing food, justifying his actions as a necessary evil.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Worth every copper.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, we both know that's a bit steep.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in Fruitville.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I've been comin' to your stall for years now. You know I always pay a fair price, but these apples are a bit steep for my budget.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, I can't let these beauties go for that price. How about we say...
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I always pay a fair price, but that's a bit steep for me. How about we say...
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 3 coins
          Current time: 1895-09-14 00:10:00.


          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 3 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is a merchant in Fruitville who is trying to sell fruit. He recently had a deal fall through with Della Plumstone and is currently negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit.           Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Lennon Figtree's offer of 3 coins.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (b)

      Stage index

      How many players acted so far this stage

1895-09-15 00:00:00 Scene 6 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Lennon Figtree']
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- premise: In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
    Lennon Figtree -- premise: In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

1895-09-15 00:00:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree -- "So, Della, what do you say? These peaches are the juiciest you'll find in Fruitville.
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- "So, Della, what do you say? These peaches are the juiciest you'll find in Fruitville.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Worth every copper.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, we both know that's a bit steep.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in Fruitville.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I've been comin' to your stall for years now. You know I always pay a fair price, but these apples are a bit steep for my budget.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, I can't let these beauties go for that price. How about we say...
      Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I always pay a fair price, but that's a bit steep for me. How about we say...


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: Lennon Figtree -- "So, Della, what do you say? These peaches are the juiciest you'll find in Fruitville.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Lennon Figtree likely to say next? Respond in the format `Lennon Figtree -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Lennon Figtree -- "So, Della, what do you say? These peaches are the juiciest you'll find in Fruitville.

1895-09-15 00:00:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those peaches do look mighty fine, but I'm on a tight budget today.
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those peaches do look mighty fine, but I'm on a tight budget today.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Worth every copper.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, we both know that's a bit steep.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in Fruitville.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I've been comin' to your stall for years now. You know I always pay a fair price, but these apples are a bit steep for my budget.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, I can't let these beauties go for that price. How about we say...
      Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I always pay a fair price, but that's a bit steep for me. How about we say...
      Lennon Figtree -- "So, Della, what do you say? These peaches are the juiciest you'll find in Fruitville.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those peaches do look mighty fine, but I'm on a tight budget today.

    • Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those peaches do look mighty fine, but I'm on a tight budget today.

      • Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.

        • Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make an offer to Lennon Figtree for the peaches.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market.         Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make an offer to Lennon Figtree for the peaches.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Della Plumstone likely to say next? Respond in the format `Della Plumstone -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those peaches do look mighty fine, but I'm on a tight budget today.

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Scene 7 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Lennon Figtree']
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- premise: Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
    Lennon Figtree -- premise: Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- 1 coin
    Event statement
  • 1 coin
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 1 coin
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • 1 coin

        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make a low offer to Lennon Figtree for the peaches.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Worth every copper.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I've been comin' to your stall for years now. You know I always pay a fair price, but these apples are a bit steep for my budget.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in Fruitville.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, I can't let these beauties go for that price. How about we say...
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I always pay a fair price, but that's a bit steep for me. How about we say...
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "So, Della, what do you say? These peaches are the juiciest you'll find in Fruitville.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those peaches do look mighty fine, but I'm on a tight budget today.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-15 00:10:00.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy peaches at a good price to resell in her hometown.
          Query
        • Della Plumstone, Della Plumstone is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy peaches at a good price to resell in her hometown.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Della Plumstone to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • 1 coin
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy peaches from Lennon Figtree. She is hoping to get a good price so she can resell them for a profit in her home town.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Worth every copper.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I've been comin' to your stall for years now. You know I always pay a fair price, but these apples are a bit steep for my budget.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those peaches do look mighty fine, but I'm on a tight budget today.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "So, Della, what do you say? These peaches are the juiciest you'll find in Fruitville.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can make an offer to Lennon Figtree for the peaches.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make a low offer to Lennon Figtree for the peaches.

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 2 coins
          (b) 5 coins
          (c) 4 coins
          (d) 3 coins
          (e) 1 coin
          Answer: (e)
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: accept

        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer of 1 coin.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Worth every copper.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in Fruitville.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I've been comin' to your stall for years now. You know I always pay a fair price, but these apples are a bit steep for my budget.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, I can't let these beauties go for that price. How about we say...
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I always pay a fair price, but that's a bit steep for me. How about we say...
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 3 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "So, Della, what do you say? These peaches are the juiciest you'll find in Fruitville.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those peaches do look mighty fine, but I'm on a tight budget today.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-16 00:00:00 Scene 8 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- premise: The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

1895-09-16 00:00:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, these apples look mighty fine, but I'm afraid your price is a bit high for me today. How about we say...
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, these apples look mighty fine, but I'm afraid your price is a bit high for me today. How about we say...
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Worth every copper.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, we both know that's a bit steep.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in Fruitville.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I've been comin' to your stall for years now. You know I always pay a fair price, but these apples are a bit steep for my budget.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, I can't let these beauties go for that price. How about we say...
      Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I always pay a fair price, but that's a bit steep for me. How about we say...
      Lennon Figtree -- "So, Della, what do you say? These peaches are the juiciest you'll find in Fruitville.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those peaches do look mighty fine, but I'm on a tight budget today.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, these apples look mighty fine, but I'm afraid your price is a bit high for me today. How about we say...

        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make a low offer to Cedric Meadowbrook.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in Fruitville.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I've been comin' to your stall for years now. You know I always pay a fair price, but these apples are a bit steep for my budget.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I always pay a fair price, but that's a bit steep for me. How about we say...
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, I can't let these beauties go for that price. How about we say...
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "So, Della, what do you say? These peaches are the juiciest you'll find in Fruitville.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those peaches do look mighty fine, but I'm on a tight budget today.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Della Plumstone stands to make profit of 5.0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree accepted the offer
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.

Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
